title: Why does learning by doing is more important? - Quora

response.answer_text: A simple process of learning includes the procedure of understanding by cues, i. e:- PQRST principle. It stands for- Preview the formatQuestion the format to get detailed information in chunksRead the formatSelf - recite or easy recalling the formatTest for learnt formatWhen we do something practically and practice it regularly we acquire the same concept clearly and completely. For mental engaging work the above works but it's best to do it (that is-) important.

You can not learn something simply theoretically, you will have to practically implement it then only you can say that I have learned that thing so until you implement it it's plain theory that's why it is important, when you practically do it you understand it more
